summary: The bill, titled the "Treatment and Relief through Emerging and Accessible Therapy for PTSD Act" (TREAT PTSD Act), mandates the Secretary of Veterans Affairs and the Secretary of Defense to provide stellate ganglion block (SGB) therapy to veterans and members of the Armed Forces diagnosed with post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD). It amends existing United States Codes to include SGB treatment and requires an update to the VA/DOD Clinical Practice Guideline for PTSD to reflect this new therapy option. The bill outlines the conditions for receiving the treatment including informed consent and defines "appropriate congressional committees". The legislation is set to take effect 180 days after its enactment.
